content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: dataset_name
      operator: matches_regex
      value: ^[A-Z][a-z0-9]{3,4}
    - name: dataset_name
      operator: not_prefix_matches_regex
      prefix: 2
      value: (ap|AP|fa|Fa)
    - name: dataset_name
      operator: is_not_contained_by
      value: <Needs to be a dynamic list of two-letter domains for respective study>
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0332
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Verifying that split domains (i.e three/four-letter domain name) have
  a two-letter parent domain present in the study
Outcome:
  Message: Two-Letter parent domain must be present when spilt datasets are present
    in the study.
Rule Type: Domain Presence Check
Sensitivity: Domain

Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0332
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: 'For domains with two-letter domain codes (i.e., other
                  than SUPPxx and RELREC), split dataset names can be up to four characters
                  in length. For example, if splitting by --CAT, then dataset names
                  would be the domain name plus up to two additional characters (e.g.,
                  QS36 for SF-36). If splitting Findings About by parent domain, then
                  the dataset name would be the domain code, "FA", plus the two-character
                  domain code for parent domain code (e.g., "FACM"). The four-character
                  dataset-name limitation allows the use of a Supplemental Qualifier
                  dataset associated with the split dataset. '
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: '6'
                Section: 4.1.7
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Exclude:
      - RELREC
      - RELSUB
      - SUPP

all.name: dataset_name
all.value: <Needs to be a dynamic list of two-letter domains for respective study>

json.Description: Verifying that split domains (i.e three/four-letter domain name) have a two-letter parent domain present in the study

Outcome.Message: Two-Letter parent domain must be present when spilt datasets are present in the study.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: For domains with two-letter domain codes (i.e., other than SUPPxx and RELREC), split dataset names can be up to four characters in length. For example, if splitting by --CAT, then dataset names would be the domain name plus up to two additional characters (e.g., QS36 for SF-36). If splitting Findings About by parent domain, then the dataset name would be the domain code, "FA", plus the two-character domain code for parent domain code (e.g., "FACM"). The four-character dataset-name limitation allows the use of a Supplemental Qualifier dataset associated with the split dataset.
